body_content.explanation: the activity of buying and selling goods and services:
examples: Currently, there are fewer firms in business (= operating) in the area than ever before.
My brother's in business.
He's in the frozen food business.
She set up in business (= started her own company) as a management consultant.
This new tax will put a lot of small firms out of business (= they will stop operating).
Our firm does a lot of business with overseas customers.
Eventually they found a consultant they felt they could do business with (= with whom they could work well).

body_content.explanation: a particular company that buys and sells goods and services:
examples: The two brothers established/set up/started up a clothes retailing business.
She runs her own printing business.
They put a lot of money into the family business.

body_content.explanation: work that you do to earn money:
examples: I'm in Baltimore on business.
a business appointment

body_content.explanation: the amount of work done or the number of goods or services sold by a company or organization:
examples: Business is good/brisk/booming/flourishing (= I'm selling a lot).
Business is bad/slack/quiet (= I'm not selling much).
How is business (= are you selling much) at the moment?

body_content.explanation: a situation or activity, often one that you are giving your opinion about:
examples: I make it my business (= I feel it is my particular duty) to check the monthly accounts.
We have some unfinished business to discuss (= we still have something important to discuss).
Arranging a trip abroad is a time-consuming business.
These killings are a horrible business.

body_content.explanation: the things that you do or the matters that relate only to you:
examples: I started on the business of filling out the form.
What she does with her life is her business.
